page.title: 13"Watcombe" Farm
page.content: 'Watcombe' is a large farm of some 300 acres,mainly pasture,60 acres are used for crops to feed the cattle and there are also 2 acres of amenity woodland. This family farm is worked by husband, wife and 2 sons,with the aid of much modern machinery.They keep over 200 head of cattle,80 Hereford beef cattle and 80 Freisian milkers,yielding an average of 6300 kilograms of milk per cow,per lactation.The 50 followers are young cows to be absorbed into the dairy herd.A pedigree bull is kept for breeding,suplemented by the Artificial Insemination Service.All animals are at grass in Summer,the milkers being given a supplement of cake in the milking parlour.The herd is housed in Winter,the beef in pens,the dairy herd in cubicles and fed on a balanced diet of hay,silage and 'bought-in' cow cake.
